alert.note: Alert for Allen; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Areas of moderate to heavy rainfall will continue this afternoon and become more widespread tonight. * WHERE...Portions of South Central and Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, in South Central Kansas, Cowley. In Southeast Kansas, Allen, Chautauqua, Elk, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho and Wilson. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall amounts of two to three inches will be common, but some areas in southeast Kansas have the potential to see amounts greater than three inches by Thursday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Neosho; Wilson
